Class Road

  • java.lang.Object
    • Road

  • public class Road
extends java.lang.Object
    This Road class serves as an "edge" bewteen two junctions.
    Author:
    Craig Lombardo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Road(Junction j1, Junction j2, int d)
      This constructor method creates a "2-way" (undirected) road between two junctions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDistance()
      This method returns the distance between the two junctions.
      Junction getOtherJunction(Junction current)
      This method returns the other junction from the current road.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Road

        public Road(Junction j1,
            Junction j2,
            int d)
        This constructor method creates a "2-way" (undirected) road between two junctions.
        Parameters:
        j1 - The first junction
        j2 - The second junction
        d - The distance between the first and second junction

    • Method Detail

      • getDistance

        public int getDistance()
        This method returns the distance between the two junctions.
        Returns:
        The distance of the road.

      • getOtherJunction

        public Junction getOtherJunction(Junction current)
        This method returns the other junction from the current road.
        Parameters:
        current - The junction at the end of the road.
        Returns:
        A Junction if there is a valid link between the current junction and this road, if not then it returns null.
